citeinfo.origin: North Carolina State University, Center for Earth Observation
citeinfo.title: Richmond National Battlefield Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Color Infrared Orthorectified Photomosaic Leaf-off

descript.abstract: Orthorectified color infrared ERDAS Imagine image of Richmond National Battlefield Park. Produced from 85 color infrared photos taken February 28, 2002. Orthorectification accomplished with Imagine Orthobase v8.6 software. Horizontal RMSE is 1.327 meters. This meets class 1 NMAS for 1:6000 scale photography. Richmond National Battlefield Park is broken into 6 pieces due to space constraints. The 6 individual pieces are listed as follows: beaverdam_chick_spring.img, cold_garth_newgain_spring.img, fort_darling_spring.img, fort_harrison_spring.img, malvern_glendale_spring.img, parkers_bat_spring.img
descript.purpose: The dataset was developed for use by Richmond National Battlefield Park as a GIS component and for digital monoplotting and mapping.

spdom.descgeog: Richmond National Battlefield Park and environs

cntaddr.address: Richmond National Battlefield Park, 3215 East Broad Street

idinfo.native: ERDAS Imagine IMG File and MrSID Compressed File

dataqual.complete: Richmond National Battlefield Park and surrounding area

horizpa.horizpar: Overall positional accuracy of 1.327 meters RMSE. Meets the NMAS Class 1 map standard for 1:6000 scale photography. Horizontal accuracy was assessed on the basis of 24 field survey points distributed throughout the image. The actual field coordinates for these points were recorded with a Trimble ProXRS GPS unit with real-time differential correction with a minimum of 180 fixes per point. The field coordinates were then post-processed using differential correction. The field coordinates were then compared to the image mosaic coordinates for these points, determined in ESRI ArcView 3.3 software.

citeinfo.title: 30 Meter Digital Elevation Model- USGS National Elevation Dataset

srcinfo.srccontr: Aerial view of Richmond National Battlefield Park

procstep.procdesc: The photos (85 total) were used to create an orthorectified mosaic using ERDAS Imagine and ER Mapper. The photos were scanned at 600 dpi and imported into Imagine. The DEMs were resampled from 30 meters to 10 meters in ArcINfo Workstation using cubic convolution and then mosaicked together. If the mosaicked DEMs had gaps, they were then run in ArcINfo Workstation using a focal mean to remove the gaps. The images were orthorectified using ERDAS Imagine Orthobase software. Airborne GPS and IMU data were used in the aerial triangulation procedure. Aerial triangulation produced a single RMSE of less than 1 meter for the entire block of photos. The orthorectified images were then mosaiced within ER Mapper to form six seamless basemap images for Richmond National Battlefield Park. The mosaics were compressed using MrSID software at a 20:1 target compression ratio.

cntaddr.address: NCSU, Center For Earth Observation NCSU Campus Box 7106

overview.eaover: Dataset consists of a raster 3 band color image. The bands are blue, green and near infrared. Each pixel contains a value between 0 - 255.

distinfo.resdesc: Downloadable Data. Orthorectified 3 band color infrared image of Richmond National Battlefield Park.

This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
